title: Plymouth shootings: Police asked to review gun licence process
description: Police in England and Wales are to assess the legitimacy of existing gun licences.

title: Nigeria's Kano state moves to ban mannequin heads on Islamic grounds
description: The Islamic police in Kano, Nigeria, say shop dummies with heads symbolise "idolatry" and are banned.

title: There and back again: The epic adventures of China's wandering elephants
description: After a mammoth journey across the country the pack of pachyderms are finally heading home.

title: Chaotic scenes at Kabul airport as Afghans flee Taliban
description: Footage from social media shows people crowding on to a plane as the Taliban entered the city.

title: John O'Groats to Land's End paramotor flight for dementia research
description: Daniel Jones says he wants to get younger people talking about dementia.

title: How do couples handle awkward chats about money?
description: From squabbles and lies to what they'd do if they won the lottery, we pose the awkward questions.

title: The zero-power sewage plant inspired by cows
description: Fifty sustainable sewage treatment plants have been built that work in similar way to a cow's stomach.

title: India's dancing cop becomes internet star
description: An Indian police officer has become a social media sensation because of his viral dance videos.

title: Why is Israel demolishing homes in East Jerusalem?
description: Israel says the homes were built without planning permission and it is to try to keep East Jerusalem in order.

title: Haiti earthquake: Rescuers search for survivors as death toll climbs to 1,297
description: More than 1,200 people are known to have died after a powerful earthquake hit the nation on Saturday.

title: Would you let a robot lawyer defend you?
description: Why artificial intelligence is increasingly being used by the legal profession.

title: Match of the Day 2 analysis: How an 'amazing' Spurs stopped Manchester City
description: Match of the Day 2's Mark Chapman, Ashley Williams and Danny Murphy look at Tottenham Hotspur's "amazing performance" as they beat Manchester City 1-0 in the Premier League.

title: Tokyo 2020: Team GB given star-studded homecoming
description: Athletes attended a concert at London's SSE Arena, Wembley, to mark their return from Tokyo.

title: Garth Crooks' team of the week: Alisson, Chalobah, Son, Salah, Fernandes
description: Which player showed why Tottenham should take the money and sell Harry Kane? Who was practically unplayable? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: Afghanistan conflict: As Kabul falls, Biden backlash grows
description: Soldiers, statesmen and Afghan-Americans criticise the president - but how will the public react?

title: England cannot rely on Root in run-chase - Moeen
description: Moeen Ali says he and his England team-mates must "take responsibility" in a potential final-day run-chase against India at Lord's.

title: Will Taliban take country back to past, asks John Simpson
description: What sort of nation will Afghanistan be after 2021, asks the BBC's world affairs editor John Simpson.

title: Afghanistan: People flee Kabul as Taliban overrun cities
description: Roads out of the Afghan capital have been choked with traffic as people try to escape a Taliban takeover.

title: Canada election: Trudeau calls snap summer campaign
description: As Prime Minister Justin Trudeau goes to the polls two years early, here's what you need to know.

title: Afghanistan: Taliban spokesman Suhail Shaheen calls the BBC - interview in full
description: A spokesman for the Taliban, Suhail Shaheen, called the BBC's Yalda Hakim, live on air.

title: A refugee puppet and meteor shower - stories you may have missed
description: We also travel back to the Ice Age and to Sao Paulo's tallest building in this week's round-up.

title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

title: Cornwall rescue: Cat's meows alert rescuers to stricken owner
description: Piran the cat leads rescuers to its 83-year-old owner, who had fallen down a 70ft (21m) ravine.

title: 'It's not just boys who can do it'
description: Girls take part in a summer scheme introducing them to careers traditionally viewed as jobs for men.
